question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Batch size limits] Does LedgerPruner pass appropriate max_versions to limit pruning batch size, or can TransactionAccumulatorPruner attempt to prune billions of versions in a single call, exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: new()] [Crash recovery] If the node crashes during the initial prune(progress, metadata_progress) catch-up, on restart will the pruner detect partial pruning and resume correctly, or can it re-prune causing idempotency issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [State machine consistency] Can the pruner enter an invalid state where progress > target_version due to concurrent updates, causing future prune operations to use negative or wrapped version ranges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Validator divergence] If different validators have different pruning configurations or timing, can TransactionAccumulatorPruner cause accumulator state to diverge between validators, breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Snapshot consistency] Can pruning accumulator nodes while snapshots are being taken cause snapshots to contain incomplete or inconsistent accumulator data that cannot be restored? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Memory leaks] If SchemaBatch operations fail and the batch is dropped without being committed, are all deletion operations properly cleaned up, or can this leak memory in the batch? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: new()] [Arc cycles] Can the Arc<LedgerDb> stored in TransactionAccumulatorPruner create reference cycles that prevent LedgerDb from being deallocated, causing memory leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Database lock duration] Does write_schemas() hold database locks for extended periods when committing large batches, potentially blocking other critical database operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune() via TransactionAccumulatorDb::prune()] [Sibling node deletion] When deleting both left_child() and right_child() of a parent position, if one deletion succeeds but the other fails, can this create an asymmetric tree structure that breaks accumulator invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune() via TransactionAccumulatorDb::prune()] [Ancestor traversal] The algorithm finds first_ancestor_that_is_a_left_child then traverses right children - can off-by-one errors in this traversal cause it to delete nodes from adjacent subtrees that should not be pruned? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune() via TransactionAccumulatorDb::prune()] [Odd version assumption] The code comment states 'The even version will be pruned in the iteration of version + 1' - can the loop terminating at an even end version violate this assumption and leave even versions unpruned? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune() via TransactionAccumulatorDb::prune()] [Postorder index] Are accumulator nodes indexed consistently using postorder traversal, or can mismatches between inorder and postorder indexing cause the wrong nodes to be deleted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Transaction info dependency] Can TransactionInfoPruner delete transaction info entries before TransactionAccumulatorPruner deletes corresponding accumulator nodes, creating dangling references? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Event store coordination] Can EventStorePruner and TransactionAccumulatorPruner prune at different rates, causing events to reference transactions whose accumulator nodes are deleted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Write set dependency] Can WriteSetPruner delete write sets before TransactionAccumulatorPruner completes, breaking the ability to reconstruct state from the accumulator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization ordering] If TransactionAccumulatorPruner::new() is called before other sub-pruners are initialized, can the catch-up pruning delete accumulator nodes that other pruners' initialization depends on? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Pruning storm] Can an attacker who influences pruning configuration trigger TransactionAccumulatorPruner to prune massive version ranges repeatedly, causing sustained high disk I/O that degrades validator performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Batch explosion] Can carefully chosen version ranges cause the pruning algorithm to generate exponentially many delete operations per version, exhausting memory in the SchemaBatch? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization delay] Can slow catch-up pruning during initialization cause TransactionAccumulatorPruner::new() to block for extended periods, delaying validator startup and affecting liveness? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Deterministic pruning] Do all validators prune exactly the same accumulator nodes given the same version range, or can non-determinism in the pruning algorithm cause state divergence between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Historical proof generation] After pruning, can the system still generate accumulator proofs for unpruned transactions, or does pruning inadvertently delete nodes required for proof paths? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Accumulator rebuild] If accumulator nodes are lost due to pruning bugs, can the accumulator be rebuilt from remaining transaction data, or does pruning create irreversible data loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Root hash verification] After pruning versions, can new nodes still verify the accumulator root hash chain for continuity, or does pruning break the ability to validate historical chain integrity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Concurrent pruning] Can multiple LedgerPruner instances running on the same database (e.g., in tests or misconfigured deployments) cause TransactionAccumulatorPruner instances to prune concurrently and corrupt each other's operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/transaction_accumulator_pruner.rs] [Function: prune()] [Version gap handling] If versions are non-contiguous due to database corruption or migration, can the pruning loop iterate over gaps correctly, or does it attempt to prune non-existent versions causing errors? (Medium)
